alert.note: Alert for Green (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 02 at 7:30PM CST until March 05 at 7:30PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Pecatonica River At Martintown affecting Green County. .Heavy rain from Monday and snow melt may cause the river to slowly rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Pecatonica River at Martintown. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Floodwaters affect Martintown Road and West River Road in the Martintown area. Upstream in Browntown, floodwaters affect highway MM and West Indies Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 6 pm... Location stage stage stage/time Fri Sat Sun Mon Martintown 13.5 9.5 12.76 7 pm 3/02 13.8 13.9 13.2 11.8 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days Martintown 12.76 7 pm 3/02 0.44 13.90 6 pm 3/04 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM CST.
